title: Coed y Felin Woodland Walk Route
description: This walk explores a delightful woodland nature reserve in Hendre, near the market town of Mold in Flintshire. There's a nice woodland trail here taking you through the site which includes ancient oak and ash woodland, grassland areas, a wildflower meadow in the summer. Also of interest are the carpets of bluebells in spring and a variety of woodland birds to watch out for. It's a little bit of a hidden gem with and a nice place for an easy peaceful stroll.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: It's a pleasant stroll for you and your dog but you are requested to keep them on leads on the site.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just a few miles to the south you'll find Loggerheads Country Park. There's a fine wooded gorge here with river walks along the River Alyn to enjoy. The popular Moel Famau Country Park is also just a few miles to the south west. There's an excellent viewpoint to enjoy here. The circular walk from the nearby Maeshafn village visits the parks and the ancient fort at Foel Fenlli. You'll also pass the neighbouring village of Cilcain where there's a significant 13th century church and a fine early 19th century pub to see. For more walking ideas in the area see the Clwydian Range Walks page.

display_address: A541, Hendre, Cilcain, Rhydymwyn, Flintshire, Cymru / Wales, CH7 5QF, United Kingdom
